CNCAN (National Commission for Nuclear Activities Control - Romania) requires the exclusion of Foreign Material (FME) following international standards, notably those established by the IAEA and WENRA, and expects licensees to have documented procedures during all stages of nuclear plant operation, including construction. These requirements include organizational responsibilities, graded approaches to prioritizing critical systems and components (SSCs), systematic controls, inspections, and continuous improvement loops that align with international good practices. CNCAN’s approach leverages standards such as ASME, CSA, ASTM, IEEE, IEC, and IAEA guides. Requirements such as AMP (Ageing Management Program) documentation and inspection reporting are central
